1.title: Explore the Proposed Updates of Windows 10
1.plot: There's still no release date in sight for Windows 10, but some of the proposed updates have developers talking. Today on Dev, Elizabeth highlights some of the new features of Windows 10 and what they might mean to you.

2.title: Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 Is Now Available for Free... For Everyone!
2.plot: First it was free for students and teachers, and now Epic Games has gone even further and made its Unreal Engine 4 free for everyone! Today on Dev, Alison will tell you what you can expect from this hugely popular game engine, and where to get it.

3.title: Disney Makes New Strides Toward the Future of Interactive Games
3.plot: Disney has always realized the importance of interaction At their theme parks. Now they're taking it one step further with a new design paradigm that will allow the accommodation of multiple story arcs in their games. Elizabeth is here to tell you more about it, today on Dev!

4.title: Spring Forward Means Renewal for Apple
4.plot: Spring brings renewal, and this year was no exception. Today on Dev, Alison outlines the pros and cons of Apple's "Spring Forward" media event, including new products and some revamped favorites.

5.title: Washington DC Announces New TechHire Initiative
5.plot: If you're a developer (or even an aspiring developer) scouring the job market without much luck, you'll be happy to hear about the latest thing to come out of Washington: the TechHire initiative. On this episode of Dev, Alison explains how the initiative will work to minimize the current tech job surplus.

6.title: Google's New Tools Mean Good New for Game Developers
6.plot: At the recent Game Developer's conference, Google unveiled some interesting new ways for game developers to view their player's progress and behavior and boost their revenue. Elizabeth will tell you more about the new tools, today on Dev.

7.title: USB Type C: What Can We Expect?
7.plot: Apple has announced a few changes that will be taking place this year, one of which is the new USB-C cord. Already in use in the Chromebook Pixel, this new USB cord is reversible, faster, and can handle different types of data. Today on Dev, Elizabeth will tell you more about the new cord to rule all cords.

8.title: Uber Aims to Encourage Use of API Through Hackathon
8.plot: Popular transportation network Uber has already partnered with some major corporations, but they're looking to get some third-party developers creating apps that use their service, too. Today on Dev, Alison talks more about the Hackathon they're running to encourage developers to get on board.

1.title: IOS 7 User Interface, YouTube Audio Library and More
1.plot: Hosts Alicia Dupuis and Rob Grgach discuss the controversy surrounding the iOS7 user interface and look at the YouTube Audio library. Learn how you can win a Google Chromecast.

2.title: Export Kit Review: Photoshop to HTML5 Fast
2.plot: Hosts Alicia Dupuis and Rob Grgach discuss Export Kit, an easy way to move your Photoshop designs to HTML5 sites fast.

3.title: Five Tips for Becoming a Better Programmer
3.plot: Hosts Ashlyn Lillibridge and Eric Cormier discuss five tips that will help you to become a better programmer.

4.title: IT Career Path: Becoming a Programmer in Five Steps
4.plot: Discover five steps that will set you on the path to becoming a programmer including learning pathways, taking courses, and creating a portfolio.

5.title: Staying Relevant: What You Need to Learn Today
5.plot: Eric Cormier and Rob Grgach discuss the skills you need to learn today in order to stay relevant in the job market of the future.

6.title: Compile Online
6.plot: In this Dev episode we look at CompileOnline.com, a site to write and test code in multiple languages from your browser.

7.title: Google Web Designer
7.plot: Learn what the Google Web Designer has to offer.

8.title: Pycharm
8.plot: In this episode of Dev, your hosts Rob Grgach and Eric Cormier discuss what Pycharm is and what it can be used for.

9.title: What Is a Database?
9.plot: Get introduced to some common types of databases and how they are each used by developers.

10.title: Turn Your Hobby Into a Part-Time Business
10.plot: On this episode of Dev, Alicia and Rob discuss what it takes to turn your programming hobby into a part time business.

11.title: Text Editor Smackdown!
11.plot: In this episode, Rob and Alicia pit four popular text editors against each other to see which one comes out on top.

12.title: Android App Store Summary
12.plot: In this episode of Dev, your hosts Alicia and Rob discuss the Android App Store, Google Play.

13.title: Bootstrap Development
13.plot: StartBootStrap.com is bringing you a number of free templates that can help you develop a responsive site quickly and easily.

14.title: Best Apps for Managing Your Time
14.plot: Hosts Eric and Rob will show you the best apps for managing your time in this episode of Dev.

15.title: Web Design: Tips and Tools of the Trade
15.plot: Your hosts, Alicia and Rob, discuss a few tips and tools to help make a web designer's life a little easier.

16.title: How to Create Money-Making Apps
16.plot: In this episode, Eric and Alicia discuss what you need to know in order to create money-making apps.

17.title: Best Money-Makin' Widgets for Your Website
17.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric discuss the best widgets to include on your website if you want to make some money.

18.title: How to Make a Terrible App
18.plot: On this episode of Dev, learn what it takes to make the worst app ever!

19.title: Free Software Development Tools
19.plot: In this episode, Alicia and Eric introduce you to free tools that developers can use to get started with their projects.

20.title: What Developers Need to Know About Design
20.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric discuss the fundamentals of good design and some basic design tools to add to your developer toolbox.

21.title: Plan Your App with Your User in Mind
21.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric discuss User Experience Design, and what to keep in mind when planning your app.

22.title: You Do Have Time for This! Find an Hour a Day to Learn Programming
22.plot: Alicia and Eric discuss how to make time in your busy schedule to learn to program.

23.title: Ten Minutes to a Better Website
23.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric discuss some simple tips and tricks to improve your webpage today!

24.title: Common Bad Habits in Coding
24.plot: In this episode of Dev, Eric and Alicia discuss some coding bad habits, and how you can fix those less-than-ideal habits in order to make your code perfect!

25.title: Becoming a More Productive Programmer
25.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Rob explore some different ways to make you a more productive programmer.

26.title: Apple App Store Summary
26.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Rob discuss some things you should know about the Apple app store.

27.title: Learning to Program Is Expensive (and Other Lies)!
27.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric debunk some common lies you may have heard--or have been perpetuating yourself--about programming.

28.title: Six Secrets to Becoming a Web Developer
28.plot: In this episode of Dev, Eric and Rob discuss six secrets that can help relieve some of your frustrations on the path to becoming a web developer.

29.title: Five Buzzwords to Include in Your Resume
29.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Rob discuss five buzzwords you may want to include in your resume to help it get the attention it deserves.

30.title: How to Make an Addictive App
30.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Rob discuss what characteristics to include in your app in order to make it addictive.

31.title: Robotics and Programming: How Are They Related?
31.plot: In this episode of Dev, Alicia and Eric discuss how programming is related to robots and how they work.

32.title: Programming on a Mac vs. PC
32.plot: In this episode of Dev, Eric and Rob discuss the pros and cons of programming on a PC versus a Mac.

1.title: Apple Announces New iPhone 6 and IOS8
1.plot: Apple has revealed the iPhone 6 and the Apple Watch at The Apple Live Event. Here's the rundown on Apple's latest devices.

2.title: Former Microsoft CEO Resigns and Phil Fish Has Had It... Again!
2.plot: News about Microsoft's former CEO, Steve Ballmer, and Polytron's founder Phil Fish.

3.title: Amazon Wins with a Twitch
3.plot: Twitch's failed courtship by Google and eventual sale to Amazon.

4.title: Getting Fit with Google
4.plot: An overview of FitBit, Withings Pulse, Misfit Shine, and other popular mobile fitness gadgets on the market.

5.title: Epic Games Makes an Unreal Deal
5.plot: Epic's subscription-free student edition of their industry standard 3D game engine, the Unreal engine.

6.title: Amazon's Fire Phone Won't Kindle
6.plot: Fire Phone's features, the public's tepid response, and Amazon's long term goal for a bright mobile future.

7.title: Nintendo's Amiibo and Their "New" Plan
7.plot: Eric explores Nintendo's upcoming answer to Skylanders and Disney Infinity-- dubbed the Nintendo Amiibos--and looks into their updated and improved "New" 3DS.

8.title: Google's Wrist Watch - Android Wear Powers Upcoming Smart Watches
8.plot: Apple's recently announced apple watch and Android Smart Watches from Motorola, Sony and ASUS that use Google's new Android Wear API.

9.title: It's Clippy Versus the Creepers with Microsoft's Purchase of Mojang
9.plot: MindSoft or MicroCraft? In this episode of Dev, Eric explains the $2.5 billion purchase of indie darling Mojang, creators of the hugely popular world-building game Minecraft, by Xbox and Windows developer Microsoft.

10.title: Swift, Apple's New IOS and OS X Programming Language, Goes Gold
10.plot: Apple's new programming language is golden delicious. In this episode of Dev, Rob goes over Swift, the new programming language developed by Apple that just went Gold. Rob looks at the exciting features of the language and explains why you want to get on board the Swift train.

11.title: Live and Let Die with Paul McCartney in Destiny
11.plot: In this episode of Dev, Eric talks about Sir Paul McCartney's contributions to the soundtrack of Bungie's planet-hopping new online shooter, Destiny.

12.title: Motorola Aims for Smartphone Supremacy with Flagship Moto X
12.plot: Motorola targets the superheroes of Android phones with their new Moto X. In this episode of Dev, Rob examines the Motorola Moto X, Motorola's new flagship Android smartphone, and looks at how it stacks up against the stiff competition from other manufacturers.

13.title: Apple Customers Bent Out of Shape Over iPhone Problems
13.plot: Pervasive pocket problems plague popular portable. In this episode of Dev, Rob looks into reports of the new iPhone 6 and 6 Plus bending in users' pockets during normal activities.

14.title: Mobile Operating System Roundup: IOS 8 and Android L
14.plot: Apple or Lemon Meringue? In this episode of Dev, Rob looks at the recently released iOS 8 and the soon to be released Android L as he explores some of the new features available in the two major mobile operating systems.

15.title: FeedHenry Under RedHat Umbrella
15.plot: RedHat is hungry for Henry. In this episode of Dev, Rob talks about open-source giant RedHat's addition of mobile application development platform FeedHenry to their portfolio of services.

16.title: Microsoft Reveals Next Windows Version, Windows 10
16.plot: Why is there no Windows 9? Because 10 8 9! In today's Dev, Rob reports on the recent Microsoft press event, where they revealed Windows 10, and goes on to discuss some of the features users can expect when the new OS is released.

17.title: Adobe Focuses on Mobile with Aviary Purchase
17.plot: Adobe is hoping that their recent business acquisition is picture-perfect. In this episode of Dev, Rob talks about Adobe's acquisition of photo editing software maker Aviary and explains what Aviary will add to Adobe's already impressive software suite.

18.title: BlackBerry Releases New Phone, the Passport
18.plot: BlackBerry hopes to turn a corner with their new square phone, the Passport. In this Dev, Rob goes over the new device from BlackBerry, the Passport, and explains why its unique form factor might make it hip to be square.

19.title: Microsoft Hopes to Spark Creativity on Xbox One, Xbox 360, and Windows 8
19.plot: Microsoft wants you to get your creative juices flowing. In this episode of Dev, Rob talks about Microsoft's recently released Project Spark, a game/creative tool set that allows players to create their own worlds and stories.

20.title: Google Adds Postal Address Requirement to Some App Developers
20.plot: Google adds a new requirement for certain app developers that has some up in arms. On today's episode of Dev, Rob discusses Google's recent requirement that paid apps or apps with in-app purchases have a postal address from the app developer prominently displayed.

21.title: Apple's October 16th Media Event Reveals Retina iMac, iPad Air 2, and More
21.plot: Apple's new tech isn't falling far from its product tree. In this Dev episode, Rob talks about Apple's October 16th media event and discusses their new Retina iMac, the iPad Air 2, and some of the new features of OS X Yosemite.

22.title: Google Wants to Start a Conversation Between You and Your Android
22.plot: In the future you won't just have conversations on your phone, you'll have conversations with your phone. In this episode of Dev, Rob takes Google's improved Google Now voice features for a test drive and compares them to the features offered by Apple's Siri and Microsoft's Cortana.

23.title: Apple Watch Developers: The Clock Is Ticking
23.plot: Apple intends to release its Apple Watch in early 2015 and is giving developers time to prepare. In this episode of Dev, Rob discusses the release of WatchKit, the SDK for Apple's upcoming Apple Watch.

24.title: InteraXon's Muse Brain Sensing Headband Review
24.plot: In this episode of Dev, Rob tests InteraXon's Muse brain-sensing headband. He talks about his time using the Muse, explains the interesting applications people have created for it, and demonstrates how easy the Muse is to use.

25.title: Ex-EA Head John Ricitiello Appointed CEO of Unity
25.plot: Democratizing game development the EA way? In this episode of Dev, Rob dissects the recent appointment of ex-EA head John Riccitiello as CEO of Unity, one of the most popular platforms for exciting, independent games.

26.title: Koding.Com Launches First Global Virtual Hackathon
26.plot: Developers who hack together, stay together. In this episode of Dev, Alison Downs talks about the upcoming Koding.com global hackathon, a first of its kind event that aims to unite developers from around the globe.

27.title: Shakeup in the Mobile Payment World as Retailers Drop Apple Pay
27.plot: Apple versus Google versus... Walmart? In today's Dev, Rob examines the recent controversy surrounding mobile payment solutions and compares Apple's Apple Pay with CurrentC, the mobile payment option backed by a consortium of top retailers.

28.title: Office 365 APIs Released for Android and IOS Developers
28.plot: Microsoft makes Office 365 more open. In this episode of Dev, Rob explores Microsoft's recent decision to open the traditionally closed Office platform to Android and iOS developers.

29.title: Microsoft Stops Shipping Retail Editions of Windows 7 and 8
29.plot: If you still need a retail copy of Windows 7 then you had better get it now. In this episode of Dev, Alison talks about Microsoft's recent end of sales for Windows 7 and Windows 8, and talks about how that effects Windows developers.

30.title: CurrentC Hack Exposes User's Email Addresses
30.plot: If you use CurrentC, you might want to change your email password. In this Dev episode, Rob looks into the recent CurrentC hack and talks about how the retail organization MCX is trying to keep Apple Pay at bay.

31.title: Mozilla Releases Firefox Developer Edition for Web App Developers
31.plot: Are you looking to develop web apps? In this episode of Dev Alison examines Mozilla's recently released Firefox Developer Edition, a complete web app IDE built into the popular Firefox browser, and explores what it offers to web developers.

32.title: Tilting Point Offers Support Services for Independent Game Developers
32.plot: Indie developers have a new option for business services. In this Dev episode, Rob talks about Tilting Point, the company founded by former EA and Zynga executives that offers support services for independent game developers.

33.title: Kano Teaches Kids how to Code with Raspberry Pi and Kano OS
33.plot: The Raspberry Pi powered Kano provides kids with a fun way to learn to program. In this episode of Dev, Rob talks about the Kano OS and Kano, an easy-to-build mini computer based on the popular Raspberry Pi, that aims to make programming fun and approachable for kids of all ages.

34.title: Ouya
34.plot: Are you an independent game developer looking to get your project into peoples' living rooms? In this episode of Dev, Alison talks about Ouya, an Android-powered microconsole that's designed to be open and easy to work with.

35.title: The World Wide Whisper - WhatsApp Introduces End-to-End Encryption for 500 Million Users
35.plot: Can you keep a secret? Today on Dev, Rob talks about the new encryption being integrated into WhatsApp, the popular Facebook-owned messaging service, and explains how it keeps your messages private.

36.title: Samsung Is Living on the Edge
36.plot: The new Galaxy Note Edge is out. In this episode of Dev, Rob looks at Samsung's newest smartphone and talks about its unique new design.

37.title: Valve Adds Steam Broadcast Game Streaming
37.plot: Valve is adding streaming to their Steam service with Steam Broadcast. Do they go together like chocolate and peanut butter, or will it be more like oil and water? In this Dev, Rob looks at how Valve implements the new Steam Broadcast, and explores this new entry into the growing world of game streaming.

38.title: Five Gifts for Programmers This Holiday Season
38.plot: Are you looking for that perfect gift for the developer in your life? In this episode of Dev, Alison looks at five must-have gifts that any programmer would love to see under the tree this holiday season.

39.title: Meteor Javascript Framework Moves from Beta to 1.0
39.plot: If you're a web developer, you might want to take the time to look at the Meteor framework. In this Dev episode, Rob looks at Meteor, the JavaScript framework that just recently moved out from beta to its official 1.0 release version.

40.title: Google Releases Android Studio 1.0, Ends Support of ADT for Eclipse
40.plot: Attention Android developers! Google has declared that Android Studio is the way forward. On today's episode of Dev, Alison examines the recent announcement that Google will officially release Android Studio 1.0 and end support of the ADT plugin for Eclipse.

41.title: Video Game Awards - The Tech Behind the Games
41.plot: Who are the real winners from the Video Game Awards? On this episode of Dev, Alison looks at some of the technology behind the smaller games that were nominated for Video Game Awards - engines that anyone can use to make their own games.

42.title: Android Wear Update Brings Watchface API, Improves Usability
42.plot: Android smartwatch owners and Android Wear developers got an early Christmas present. In this episode of Dev, Alison talks about the new Android Wear API, and reveals some of its new usability features and improvements.

43.title: Godot 2D and 3D Game Engine Released
43.plot: Good news for all you game developers waiting for a new engine, Godot has arrived. In today's Dev, Alison discusses the 1.0 release of Godot, a powerful, open-source 2D and 3D game engine developed by Okam Studios.

44.title: CES 2015: The Internet of Things and More Apps on TV
44.plot: You can find everything under the sun at CES, and since CES is held in Las Vegas there's a lot of sun. Alison sorted through all the tech on offer and identified a few trends that might interest you. She'll talk about those trends, today on Dev.

45.title: CES 2015: Alison's Five Favorite Gadgets
45.plot: Every year CES showcases thousands of interesting gadgets. On this episode of Dev, Alison will talk about five cool pieces of tech from this year's show, including the Mother and Motion cookies and the Petcube.

46.title: Google Ends Glass Explorer Program, But Glass Lives On
46.plot: Did Google just throw their Glass project down a hole? In today's episode of Dev, Alison looks into the end of the Google Glass Explorer program, and talks about what that means for future of the wearable device, and Google Glass app developers.

47.title: Updates to Google Maps Add Features and Improve Usability
47.plot: Google has updated their popular Google Maps application for iOS users. On this Dev episode, Alison talks about some of the new features of Google Maps on iOS and explores why they might be useful.

48.title: Microsoft's HoloLens: A Product or A Platform?
48.plot: Microsoft's big Windows 10 event included an even bigger reveal - the HoloLens. On this episode of Dev, Alison discusses Microsoft's plans for the HoloLens, their embrace of innovation, and what the recent success of the Surface Pro could mean for Microsoft's holographic moon shot.

49.title: The Raspberry Pi Foundation Has Just Released the Raspberry Pi 2
49.plot: It may be small, but they managed to jam a lot into the new Raspberry Pi. In this episode of Dev, Alison talks about the Raspberry Pi 2, the newest credit-card sized computer from the Raspberry Pi Foundation, and looks at how it's improved on its famously hackable predecessor.

50.title: Goodbye, Google Glass... Hello, Sony SmartEyeGlass!
50.plot: Google may have put the kibosh to the Google Glass Explorer program, but Sony was waiting in the wings. Today on Dev, Alison catches you up on the new Sony SmartEyeGlass: what is it, how does it differ from Google Glass, and what does it mean for developers?

51.title: YouTube Gets a Kid-Friendly Makeover
51.plot: If you're a parent or guardian, you already know that YouTube can be a great source of entertainment for kids. Well, a new kid-friendly makeover has just made YouTube even better, and you're going to love the results! On this episode of Dev, Alison details the pros and cons of the brand new app, YouTube Kids.

52.title: First Annual Twitch Convention Announced
52.plot: Pack your bags and start researching flights into San Francisco--Twitch has just announced their first ever convention! Today on Dev, Alison will tell you more about this upcoming "celebration of all things Twitch."
